medical_guidelines.description: Fever is a temporary increase in body temperature, often due to illness
medical_guidelines.treatment: Rest, increase fluid intake, paracetamol/acetaminophen 500-1000mg every 4-6 hours (max 4g/day), ibuprofen 200-400mg every 6-8 hours. Seek medical attention if fever >39°C (102°F) persists >3 days

medical_guidelines.description: Proper wound care prevents infection and promotes healing
medical_guidelines.treatment: Clean hands first. Stop bleeding with direct pressure. Clean wound with clean water. Apply antibiotic ointment if available. Cover with sterile bandage. Change dressing daily

medical_guidelines.description: Loss of body fluids, common in hot climates or during illness
medical_guidelines.treatment: Oral rehydration solution (ORS): 1 liter clean water + 6 tsp sugar + 1/2 tsp salt. Drink small amounts frequently. Avoid alcohol and caffeine
Sit upright, loosen tight clothing, ensure fresh air. If asthma: use inhaler if available. Seek immediate medical attention

medical_guidelines.description: Frequent loose or watery bowel movements
medical_guidelines.treatment: Maintain hydration with ORS. BRAT diet (bananas, rice, applesauce, toast). Avoid dairy and fatty foods. Zinc supplements if available (10-20mg daily)

medical_guidelines.description: Dangerously high blood pressure requiring immediate attention
medical_guidelines.treatment: Seek immediate medical attention. Sit upright, stay calm. Do not lower BP too quickly. If available: sublingual nifedipine 10mg

medical_guidelines.description: Severe high or low blood sugar requiring immediate care
medical_guidelines.treatment: If conscious and able to swallow: give sugar/glucose. If unconscious: recovery position, seek immediate help. Monitor breathing

medical_guidelines.description: General approach to managing pain with limited resources
medical_guidelines.treatment: Paracetamol 500-1000mg every 4-6 hours (max 4g/day). Ibuprofen 200-400mg every 6-8 hours with food. Cold/heat therapy. Rest and elevation if applicable

steps: Begin CPR: 30 chest compressions, 2 rescue breaths
Continue until help arrives or person responds
Elevate injured area above heart if possible
